query: When do I need a Smart Account

predictions.answer:
{"VCA_ID": "VCA-658", "profile_label_override": "Smart Account", "answer": "

You need a Smart Account to place a sales order for Smart Licenses. You need a Smart Account before you can place an order for Smart Licensing products in Cisco Commerce Workspace (CCW).

\n

Note: Smart Accounts are not mandatory for all the products.

", "sub_technology": "Customer Education (SA/CSSM help)", "technology": "Smart Licensing", "unique_id": "217"}
predictions.sent: When do I need a Smart Account?

predictions.answer:
{"VCA_ID": "VCA-697", "profile_label_override": "Smart Account", "answer": "

Smart Accounts are now mandatory for all Enterprise Agreements (EAs). This enables the information to be tracked more thoroughly than it was in the past. Refer to the Help content in EA portal for more information.

You should be able to access your Smart Account from the Cisco Software Central portal using the following steps:

  1. Log in to Cisco Software Central. You should see the Smart Account that you currently have access to displayed in the Smart Account drop-down menu.
    Note: If you have access to more than one Smart Account, then you can see those Smart Accounts in the drop-down menu.
  2. Search for a particular account by its Name, Domain Identifier, or account status.
  3. Select the desired Smart Account to see the detailed information.
  4. Navigate to Administration > Manage Smart Account > Account Properties to view basic account information such as Smart Account Name, Account Domain Identifier, or company HQ Address.

Any user with access to the Smart Account with any role based association can view the basic Smart Account information in the Account Properties page. Navigate to Manage Smart Account > Users to view the users who have access to the Smart Account.

", "sub_technology": "Customer Education (SA/CSSM help)", "technology": "Smart Licensing", "unique_id": "263"}

{"VCA_ID": "VCA-685", "profile_label_override": "Smart Account", "answer": "

A Partner can only initiate or request a Smart Account on a customer's behalf.

Partners can request a Customer Smart Account on the behalf of their customers from Cisco Software Central. Partners can also request a Customer Smart Account for their customer from the Cisco Commerce Workplace (CCW).

Only a customer can activate the Smart Account because it requires the customer's company to agree to a Cisco agreement. Customers can also directly request and create their Smart Account from Cisco Software Central.

The End Customer User needs to complete the Smart Account creation.

", "sub_technology": "Customer Education (SA/CSSM help)", "technology": "Smart Licensing", "unique_id": "250"}
predictions.sent: Can a Partner create a Smart Account for the customer or does the customer need to create the Smart Account themselves?

predictions.sent: Do I need a Smart Account while ordering?

predictions.answer:
{"VCA_ID": "VCA-661", "profile_label_override": "Smart Account", "answer": "

Partner Holding Account

These are held by Distributors or Resellers, who are Partners. Partners use a Partner Holding Account to temporarily store assigned orders until the End Customer Smart Account is identified.

Customer Smart Account 

Smart Account enabled licenses are deposited in the Customer Smart Account. Customers, Partners, or an authorized party can manage licenses directly.

For more information on Smart Accounts, navigate to Cisco.com.

", "sub_technology": "Move So from Partner/holding SA to correct end customer", "technology": "Smart Licensing", "unique_id": "222"}
predictions.sent: When do I need to use a Customer Smart Account and when do I need to use a Partner Holding Account?

predictions.answer:

For more information on Smart Accounts, navigate to Cisco.com.

", "sub_technology": "Move So from Partner/holding SA to correct end customer", "technology": "Smart Licensing", "unique_id": "222"}
